intro: Fadogia stenophylla var. rhodesiana, commonly known as Rhodesian velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is known for its hairy, velvety foliage, which gives it its common name. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in disturbed soils. The species is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
